meanings.definition: A person who is excessively deferential or submissive to those in authority.
meanings.sent1: The timeservers always agreed with the boss, no matter what.
meanings.sent2: The timeservers in the office never questioned the decisions of their superiors.
meanings.sent3: The timeservers were like loyal followers, always nodding in agreement.
meanings.sent4: She saw the timeservers as obedient sheep, following the leader without question.
meanings.sent5: The timeservers were like shadows, always following the powerful figures.

meanings.definition: A device or system that keeps track of time, especially in a precise manner.
meanings.sent1: The timeservers in the clock tower ensured accurate timekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The timeservers synchronized all the clocks in the building.
meanings.sent3: The timeservers in the watch were like tiny guardians of time.
meanings.sent4: The timeservers hummed quietly, measuring each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The timeservers ticked diligently, marking the seconds with precision.
